title: Dražen Bošnjaković
text:
Dražen Bošnjaković (born 6 January 1961) is a Croatian politician who had served as the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Justice%20%28Croatia%29">Minister of Justice</a> in the <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Andrej%20Plenkovi%C4%87">cabinet</a> of <a href="Andrej%20Plenkovi%C4%87">Andrej Plenković</a> from 2017 to 2020.
Early life and education.
Bošnjaković was born in <a href="Vukovar">Vukovar</a> in 1961. He lived in <a href="Ilok">Ilok</a> until he was eighteen. He was a good student, and after finishing high school he went to Zagreb and studied at the Law faculty. 
Career.
On beginning his career Bošnjaković worked in the Council of <a href="Ivani%C4%87%20Grad">Ivanić Grad</a>, and from 1993 until 1997 he was a secretary in <a href="Sisak-Moslavina%20County">Sisak-Moslavina County</a>. After that he started his own law firm and worked as a lawyer until entering into politics. He became a member of the <a href="Croatian%20Parliament">Croatian Parliament</a> on December 23, 2003, and served until January 11, 2008. From 2008, he was a state secretary in the Ministry of Justice of Republic of <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>, and he is a member of the Central Committee of <a href="Croatian%20Democratic%20Union">Croatian Democratic Union</a> (HDZ). He is vice-president of the County Committee of HDZ of <a href="Zagreb%20County">Zagreb County</a> for then years.
Personal life.
He is married and he is father of three children. He speaks <a href="English%20language">English</a>, and his hobbies are biking, skiing, and tennis.
